meanings.definition: The quality or state of being muddy or swampy.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the miriness of the path made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The miriness of the wetlands attracted many different types of birds.
meanings.sent3: The miriness of the situation was so deep that even the most experienced hiker got stuck.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a miriness of conflicting thoughts, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The miriness of the forest floor sucked at their boots with each step.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being full of mire or mud.
meanings.sent1: The miriness of the field made it impossible to play soccer after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The miriness of the construction site caused delays in building the new house.
meanings.sent3: The miriness of the garden was a challenge for the kids who wanted to play outside.
meanings.sent4: His words were like miriness, sticking to her mind and clouding her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The miriness of the riverbank made it treacherous for the fishermen to navigate.
